articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli tanks thrust deeper on Monday into two north Gaza towns and a historic refugee camp, trapping around 100,000 civilians, the Palestinian emergency service said, in what the military said were operations to root out regrouping Hamas militants.
articles.title: Palestinians say 100,000 residents trapped in Israel's north Gaza assault

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Falling debris from a destroyed Russian drone injured two people and set a residential building on fire in Kyiv, the mayor of the Ukrainian capital said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Two people injured in Russia's drone attack on Ukraine's Kyiv, mayor says

articles.author: Gram Slattery, Helen Coster, Andrea Shalal
articles.description: Republican and Democratic leaders alike and Puerto Rican celebrities bashed comments made at a major Donald Trump event in New York by a comedian who called Puerto Rico a "floating island of garbage."
articles.title: US politicians, celebrities blast Trump-allied comedian for calling Puerto Rico 'garbage'

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The United States and the European Union called for a full investigation into reports of violations in an election in Georgia, where the president urged protests on Monday following the disputed parliamentary vote.
articles.title: US, EU call for probe after reports of Georgia election violations

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The United States warned Iran at the United Nations on Monday that if it undertakes any further aggressive acts against Israel or U.S. personnel in the region "there will be severe consequences."
articles.title: US warns Iran at UN of 'severe consequences' if further attacks

articles.author: Monica Machicao, Lucinda Elliott
articles.description: Bolivian ex-president Evo Morales told Reuters on Monday that the government of ally-turned-rival President Luis Arce was behind an alleged gun attack on his convoy, lashing out at what he called a "dark plot to destroy" him.
articles.title: Bolivia's Morales says government has 'dark plot to destroy' him after alleged car attack

articles.author: Joe Cash
articles.description: China's Ministry of State Security said on Tuesday that it had retrieved spying devices both on the ocean surface and in the depths of the sea, including underwater "lighthouses" that could guide the transit of foreign submarines.
articles.title: China warns of deep-sea spying devices, underwater 'lighthouses' that guide foreign submarines

articles.author: Ben Blanchard, Yimou Lee
articles.description: A senior U.S. diplomat who helps manage ties with Taiwan has arrived in Taipei, the de facto U.S. embassy said on Tuesday, as Taiwanese officials sought to downplay Donald Trump's latest attacks of the island's crucial chip industry and defence needs.
articles.title: Senior US diplomat arrives in Taiwan as officials downplay Trump comments

articles.author: Diego Oré
articles.description: Mexico's Supreme Court published a proposal on Monday to invalidate core parts of a controversial judicial overhaul that has rattled markets and shaken investor confidence in Latin America's second-largest economy.
articles.title: Mexico Supreme Court justice challenges controversial judicial reform

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: NATO Secretary General Mark Rutte confirmed on Monday that North Korean troops have been sent to Russia and that North Korean military units have been deployed to the Kursk region.
articles.title: NATO chief says he can confirm North Korean troops are in Russia's Kursk
